title: Arsenal Diary : What in store this week | News
body_text:
Premier League football is back this week after the men’s international break comes to an end, and our women’s team will also be back in Women’s Champions League and WSL action.
Here’s what to look out for on Arsenal.com and the official app over the next seven days:
MONDAY
Weekend reaction
We’ll be sharing a round-up of our players on international duty who had games over the weekend, including Ghana (Thomas Partey), Spain (David Raya, Mikel Merino), Poland (Jakub Kiwior), and England (Declan Rice, Bukayo Saka).
Loan Watch will keep you up-to-date on how our loanees got on at their clubs last week.
TUESDAY
International round-up
Ghana, Belgium, France and Italy are all in action on Monday, so expect the latest on Thomas Partey, Leandro Trossard, William Saliba and Riccardo Calafiori on Tuesday morning.
Trossard looks back to focus on his future
We catch up with Leandro Trossard to find out how our in-form forward has put everything he’s learnt in his career to good use to continue an incredible upward trajectory.
Renee Slegers press conference
Following Jonas Eidevall's departure, our women’s interim head coach will speak to the media at Sobha Realty Training Centre for the pre-Valerenga press conference.
She will look ahead to Wednesday’s UEFA Women’s Champions League game at Emirates Stadium, share the latest team news and more.
WEDNESDAY
International round-up
Wrapping up the international coverage, find out how our players performed on Tuesday, including the latest from Spain (David Raya, Mikel Merino), Poland (Jakub Kiwior) and Brazil (Gabriel, Gabriel Martinelli).
Colney Carpool with Mikel Merino
Our summer signing completes his initiation by hopping in the Frimborghini to answer some fun questions and challenge himself with a spot of target practice.
8pm - Arsenal Women v Valerenga
We’re looking for our first win in the Women’s Champions League this season when Valerenga visit Emirates Stadium.
The Norwegian side lost their opening game 1-0 at home to Juventus, and tickets for Wednesday’s match are available.
Supporters who aren’t in attendance can follow the action live on DAZN.
THURSDAY
Cherry-picking the classics
We’re looking back at a selection of the best of our previous meetings with Bournemouth ahead of the weekend’s game at Vitality Stadium.
FRIDAY
Press conferences
Mikel Arteta sits down in front of the media at Sobha Realty Training Centre to look ahead to our trip to the south coast this weekend, whilst Renee Slegers will be previewing our Barclays Women’s Super League game at West Ham United.
Watch the press conferences here on Arsenal.com or the official app or read up on all of the quotes afterwards.
SATURDAY
12pm - Arsenal U18s v Aston Villa
Jack Wilshere’s young Gunners are back in U18 Premier League South action at Sobha Realty Training Centre to take on Aston Villa at lunchtime on Saturday.
We’re unbeaten in the league so far with two wins and three draws from five games, while Villa are top with 13 points from six matches.
5.30pm - Bournemouth v Arsenal
We look to continue our impressive, unbeaten start to the Premier League campaign when we face Bournemouth in Dorset on Saturday evening.
It’s been a mixed bag of results for Andoni Iraola’s side, who have eight points from seven games having most recently lost 1-0 away to Leicester City before the international break.
We will bring you all the pre-match build-up on Arsenal.com and the official app, with our matchday show Live From N5 starting an hour before kick-off. Post-match interviews, highlights and a full match replay will be published after the game.
SUNDAY
3pm - West Ham United v Arsenal Women
It’s a trip to the Chigwell Construction Stadium this weekend as we face West Ham in Barclays Women’s Super League.
Supporters not attending the game can follow the action live on the WSL YouTube channel.
